WRITING.TITLE: Really need to read a good book!!
WRITING.TEXT: Heyyy.. I was wondering if anyone could suggest me a war novel.. Or any book that is not particularly too happy.. A book which is based on a real life setting.. Thank you so much:)

WRITING.TITLE: Want to read something that would blow my mind!!
WRITING.TEXT: Heyyy guys! I was wondering if you could suggest me some books .. maybe related to war or anything that isn't specifically happy.. Something that could leave me wanting for more..
Okayy thanks but is like *salt to the sea* by ruta spetys?
Try *miss peregrine's home for peculiar children*.. It is not very spooky... But I loved it..
1984-george orwell
Any Paulo coelho book.. And also take care:)
Between the shades of grey. It is a World War 2 novel and when I finished it, it left me with a hollow feeling inside. But I guess any war novel can do that to you.
Can you explain what u meant by the last paragraph?
Ohh.. The ending makes the story so much more engaging!!

Salt to the sea - I have read it a couple of times till now. The tattooist of Auschwitz- ( not exactly a spoiler, but if you are reading this book or wish to read this book, don't read ahead) The ending was a little unsettling. And by *little* I mean a lot . Don't get me wrong, I am not a sadist. It is just that in the most books that I have read about world wars, the ending is always predictable. The ending of this particular book made me dwell on the concept of * happy endings* for a little while. Okay, wait the ending wasn't happy exactly, but the ending gave us hope that maybe if you stay strong for a little while longer, you might be able to get out of the bad situation after all. Can anyone else relate? The diary of a young girl- This was my first novel that I read on world War 2. Haven't been able to keep any book on world War 2 down. The book intrigued me to read more on world War 2, to read about other survivors and victims. Holocaust was one of the worst spine shivering incidents in history to take place.

WRITING.TITLE: School is about to start, so wanted to read as many books i can before this sad phase begins(again):/
WRITING.TEXT: Can anyone please suggest books like all the bright places, fault in our stars, everything everything.
From where I am, they have just extended the vacations till 31st. I hope you are safe wherever you are:)
Yeah... I read it some time back.. And I absolutely loved it:)
Thank you!

WRITING.TITLE: A book that made you wish you were dead
WRITING.TEXT: Okay, it sounds a little too dark but what was the book that gave you a new perspective towards life? Not a self help book but a story that moved you.
Thank you:)
Haha.. Thanks for the concern!
You said that the quiz was accurate but Hitler commited suicide. He was never tried for his crimes. Correct me if I am wrong ?
Oh okayy.. So this incident took place before Holocaust and world War 2? Why was he put on trial for treason? I mean what did he particularly do to be charged for treason?
Oh got it. Thank you so much! Is there a book I could to refer to know more about the circumstances revolving around world War 2 , rise and fall of Hitler?

Thank you so much once again! We too had a chapter concerning world War 2 in 9th but it was pretty vague and didn't exactly give a clear idea over the event. I have been trying to follow the event and the circumstances leading to it for a while now. Thank you for the suggestion!

WRITING.TITLE: Losing friends
WRITING.TEXT: Books about friends growing distant.
Low key Master Oogway and Master Shifu vibes.

WRITING.TITLE: Castor oil or olive oil?
WRITING.TEXT: Heyy.. I don't exactly have a hair care routine. (Ik) Lately I have been thinking about getting on board on the *hair care routine train*. I have dry, frizzy hair. My hair gets oily faster on the scalp as compared to my lengths. Hair loss is genetic in my family. I have lost almost half of my hair in the last 4years. I am thinking about start oiling my hair. But I can't decide between castor oil and olive oil. Can you guys help me, please? I need a hair oil which will reduce hairfall and promote hair growth making my hair thicker. Thank you so much:) Edit: I don't use any conditioner just any good old shampoo. I use any shampoo that I find in the bathroom..
*us*
The cube
Those last two lines!!!!!!!!!!!! I mean!!! So damn good!!
The ending line was awesome.. I mean----

WRITING.TITLE: Dyed my hair, I need product recommendations:)
WRITING.TEXT: So, I got my hair dyed recently. My undyed hair were frizzy from the start and now they have just gotten more out of control. I was wondering if anyone could recommend a color safe shampoo, conditioner and a leave in conditioner(paraben and sulfate free). My hair tends to get oily faster at the roots than my ends.. Thank you so much. :) Edit:I have been using matrix biolage anti breakage shampoo and conditioner but it is not sulfate or paraben free.
